We Are DICE

DICE (EA Digital Illusions Creative Entertainment), the award-winning developer based in Stockholm, Sweden, is best known for creating the acclaimed Battlefield and Star Wars Battlefront franchises.

The Opportunity Ahead

As an Associate Quality Designer, your role is versatile with many areas of focus and responsibilities. A quality designer is a catalyst ensuring that QV understands the design and that its features are tested and ensuring that the quality of the game lives up to our players expectations. An Associate Quality Designer at DICE are embedded in development and will test, document, and analyze the game during production. More specifically, as part of the Engine QV team you will partner with the Software Engineering development groups, working on the latest games and the technology behind their creation. Your role in this will also be to improve the creation experience for developers, and the game quality experience for our players. You will report to the lead or manager of the Engine QV team who will assist and guide you.

Responsibilities

By joining the Engine QV(Quality Verification) team, you will work with software engineers and build engineers to improve integration testing, identifying root causes and automation. You will work with continuous integration, analyze stability and performance results, and contribute to a data-driven culture. You will help ensure not only the quality of the games but also the tools and processes we use to build them.

	You will participate in technical testing efforts for important areas within the projects ongoing at DICE.
	Track data and metrics to measure the impact of changes on relevant areas and adapt to meet the needs of the projects and established quality standards.
	Establish good collaborations with both your QV peers and Dev partners, promoting a focus on quality of tests and healthy workflows.
	Manage areas you are assigned to, becoming a central point of contact and use your expertise in that area, reporting and communicating effectively to partners.
	Troubleshoot issues raised as part of the ongoing testing efforts and assist development in resolving these as efficiently as possible.
	Escalate to leadership immediately recognized important issues and testing deficiencies while investing to improve the used processes.

Qualifications

	Experience with Programming Languages such as C#, Python and C++; can use related tools such as MS Visual Studio to program and debug code is desirable.
	A general understanding of build systems, pipelines, continuous integration, unit tests, automation, and testing frameworks.
	You will understand visual scripting for whitebox testing and game logic debugging.
	General comprehension of software development processes, understanding of software production milestones and the DevOps approach to development.
	Familiarity with tools such as JIRA, Testrail or equivalent bug and test case management systems is also preferable.

This is a 12-month contract role, and applications will be selected on an ongoing basis.

Applicants must be living in Sweden, as we do not offer a relocation package for this role.

About EA

At Electronic Arts, we exist to Inspire the World to Play. We create extraordinary new game experiences for our millions of players everywhere by bringing together talented people that combine creativity, innovation, and passion. We know that our strength lies in the diversity of our people. We immerse our employees into an inclusive culture, and provide opportunities for learning and leading that allow them to do the most impactful and rewarding work of their careers.

We put our people first. We provide comprehensive benefit packages with a focus on health and wellbeing to support your needs and help you balance your career and personal life. We provide access to dynamic and collaborative work environments, opportunities to connect and contribute through our Employee Resource Groups, and support for a balanced life with paid time off and maternity and paternity leave, plus free video games and so much more!

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Electronic Arts also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.
